questionText: The ansa cervicalis supplies the following muscle:

options: Contraction of one muscle rotates the face to the same side.
It is crossed superficially by the external jugular vein.
It is supplied by the transverse cervical nerve.
It is superficial to the deep cervical fascia.

questionText: Regarding carotid triangle, mark one true statement:
options: Its floor is formed by hyoglossus and geniohyoid muscles.
It contains all branches of the external carotid artery.
It is bounded posteriorly by the anterior border of sternocleidomastoid muscle.

questionText: Which is not considered a content of the posterior triangle of the neck:
Passing through an interval between the superior and middle constrictor muscles (2nd gap) is:
options: The internal laryngeal nerve and superior laryngeal artery.
The superior laryngeal artery and recurrent laryngeal nerve.

questionText: The nerve supply of scalenus anterior muscle comes from the cervical nerves:
The following structures are contents of the carotid sheath except:
One of the following muscles is not supplied by the pharyngeal plexus:
Regarding infrahyoid muscles, select the false statement:
options: They are supplied by hypoglossal nerve.
Superior belly of omohyoid lies between carotid and muscular triangles.

questionText: Structure embedded in the anterior wall of the carotid sheath:
Injury to inferior alveolar nerve, which muscle is paralyzed:
One of the following muscles is supplied by a branch from C1:
Regarding posterior triangle of neck, one of the following is incorrect:
options: It is bounded anteriorly by posterior border of sternomastoid.
It is bounded posteriorly by anterior border of trapezius.
It is bounded inferiorly by medial third of clavicle.
Investing layer of fascia is in its roof.

questionText: One of the following structures is not superficial to the scalenus anterior muscle:
Regarding sternocleidomastoid, one of the following statements is true:
options: It arises from the back of the manubrium.
It turns the face to the opposite side.
It is related superficially to the external jugular vein.
It is supplied by spinal part of accessory nerve.

questionText: A man developed a trauma causes injury to the inferior alveolar nerve, which of the following muscles would most likely be paralyzed:
Which of the following statements about the sternomastoid muscle is FALSE?
options: It is supplied by the spinal accessory nerve
When acting alone, it turns the face to the opposite side
It is attached to the mastoid process and superior nuchal line
It flexes the cervical vertebral column when both muscles act together

questionText: The stylopharyngeus muscle is innervated by which cranial nerve?
